Articles.Content:
Hi, everyone.

Our host is planning a maintenance period of up to 30 minutes tomorrow, July 15, between the hours of 9am and 6pm BST (GMT +1). Please plan accordingly.

Thanks.
Will this help the 502 errors?
I will be asleep during this downtime. Yay time zones

Forum maintenance, eh? Suuuure, i will plan accordingly - i will restock snacks and fizzy drinks while you maintenance away. And then i will totally be surprised by appeareance of 0.24 ready to download not.
Oh... Rats. Oh well!

Forum maintenance, eh? Suuuure, i will plan accordingly - i will restock snacks and fizzy drinks while you maintenance away. And then i will totally be surprised by appeareance of 0.24 ready to download not.

I'm hoping this is in fact not just a coincidence, but alas, it probably is. No use in getting my hopes up.</SPAN>

Will this help the 502 errors?

So I'm not the only one having these? They have been plaguing me so much lately. I hope it will fix it.

I'm hoping this is in fact not just a coincidence, but alas, it probably is. No use in getting my hopes up.</SPAN>

It's on the host's end. Sorry, guys.

Will this help the 502 errors?

Yeah, should cut them by at least 98 points.

So I'm not the only one having these? They have been plaguing me so much lately. I hope it will fix it.

Yeah, these have been such a pain for me too. I've taken to copying my longer replies to Notepad before I hit "post", because all too often the message gets eaten by the 502 monster.

Yeah, should cut them by at least 98 points.

Oh snap!

.

It's on the host's end. Sorry, guys.

Ah, but the first rule of espionage is misdirection. Lies upon lies, layers upon layers. I'll stay hopeful.

A temp fix for those 502s though (only on windows):

1. do windows key + r. The run box should come up

2. in the run box type 'cmd' and hit enter.

3. Windows Command Prompt will open.

4. Then type 'ipconfig -flushdns'. This will flush your dns, obviously.

5. Disconnect from your network, and close any browsers

6. reconnect, and go back to the forums.

This 6-step process always works for me.

30 minutes tomorrow, July 15, between the hours of 9am and 6pm BST (GMT +1)

Ah, good to see your host has giving you a very specific timeframe.

"Plan accordingly" around complete uncertainty.

I'm not blaming you, of course! This is as much an annoyance to you guys as to us. It's just funny.

I'll stay hopeful.

*coughdelusionalcough*

Ah, good to see your host has giving you a very specific timeframe.

"Plan accordingly" around complete uncertainty.

Their host must be an American cable company.

A temp fix for those 502s though (only on windows):

1. do windows key + r. The run box should come up

2. in the run box type 'cmd' and hit enter.

3. Windows Command Prompt will open.

4. Then type 'ipconfig -flushdns'. This will flush your dns, obviously.

5. Disconnect from your network, and close any browsers

6. reconnect, and go back to the forums.

This 6-step process always works for me.

that is hardly a quick fix

[...]between the hours of 9am and 6pm BST (GMT +1).[...]

I'd like to thank you for stating the time zone.

Please feel hugged.

I didn't start getting 502 errors until I read that people were getting 502 errors.

Hmmm....

that is hardly a quick fix

By the time you're done, the 502 error already went away anyway!

I didn't start getting 502 errors until I read that people were getting 502 errors.

Hmmm....

Same here, seriously weird.

...but ctrl + F5 fixed it instantly. So no issue here for me.

With the current hype for 0.24 going on and a whole heap of extra traffic coming to the forums I've tweaked some things to help lighten the burden on the server. Hopefully this will reduce the amount and length of 502 error occurences.
@All (except Squad, obviously) Stop posting to this thread! Have you any idea what it's doing to me every time I think "is this the announcement" only to find it's just this! @~|

Woo! Way to go KasperVld! Btw, that quick fix is a quick fix for me because i do a lot of command prompting and batchwork. I made it quick because i made a batch file that does all of those things for me in less than a second.
Oh nuu! I'm getting 502's trying to read this thread! IT'S OVER!
Where did the blog go?!
